abstract: Memo From Israel; Israelis often conflate what is good for the state with what is good for the individual, view seen by many as great strength but by others as great weakness; view helps put in context why Israel will trade 1,000 Palestinian prisoners for return of Israeli soldier Gilad Shalit.
snippet: Israelis often conflate what is good for the state with what is good for the individual, a view seen by many as a strength but by others as a weakness.
lead_paragraph: Israelis often conflate what is good for the state with what is good for the individual, a view seen by many as a strength but by others as a weakness.

headline.main: A Yearning for Solidarity Tangles Public Life
headline.print_headline: A Yearning for Solidarity Complicates Public Life, Israelis Say
headline.seo: Gilad Shalit’s Case Accents Israel’s Desire for Solidarity
